questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a JavaScript data type?
questions.explanation: JavaScript does not have a separate Character type. Characters are represented as strings.

questions.question: What is the difference between let and var?
options: let has function scope, var has block scope
var has block scope, let has function scope
let has block scope, var has function scope
questions.explanation: let is block-scoped while var is function-scoped, which helps prevent bugs.

questions.question: What will typeof null return?
questions.explanation: Due to a historical bug in JavaScript, typeof null returns 'object'.

questions.question: Which function is used to convert a JSON string into a JavaScript object?
questions.explanation: JSON.parse() converts a JSON string into a JavaScript object.

questions.question: Which method is used to add an element to the end of an array?
questions.explanation: push() adds one or more elements to the end of an array.

questions.question: What is a closure in JavaScript?
options: A function having access to its outer scope
A block of code that executes immediately
A method used to close a program
questions.explanation: A closure allows a function to access variables from its outer scope even after the outer function has executed.

questions.question: Which keyword is used to create a promise?
questions.explanation: Promises are created using the Promise constructor with new Promise().

questions.question: What does the async keyword do?
options: Makes a function return a Promise
questions.explanation: An async function always returns a Promise.

questions.question: Which DOM method is used to select an element by ID?
questions.explanation: getElementById() selects an element using its unique ID.

questions.question: What will be the output of: console.log(2 + '2')?
questions.explanation: JavaScript performs type coercion, converting number 2 to string and concatenating.

questions.question: What is Java?
questions.explanation: Java is a high-level, object-oriented programming language used to build applications for different platforms.

questions.question: Who developed Java?
questions.explanation: Java was developed by Sun Microsystems in 1995, which was later acquired by Oracle.

questions.question: Which keyword is used to create a class in Java?
questions.explanation: The class keyword is used to declare a class in Java.

questions.question: Which method is executed first in Java?
questions.explanation: The main() method is the starting point of every Java application.

questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
questions.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets and is used to style HTML elements.

questions.question: Which property controls the text size?
questions.explanation: font-size is used to control the size of text.

questions.question: What is the default position value in CSS?
questions.explanation: static is the default position value for HTML elements.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to create space inside an element?
questions.explanation: padding creates space between the content and the border of an element.

questions.question: Which display property value enables Flexbox?
questions.explanation: Setting display: flex enables the Flexbox layout model.

questions.question: Which unit is relative to the font size of the root element?
questions.explanation: rem is relative to the root element's font size.

questions.question: Which property is used to make an element invisible but still take space?
questions.explanation: visibility: hidden hides the element but keeps its layout space.

questions.question: Which CSS feature is used to make layouts responsive?
questions.explanation: Media queries allow styles to adapt to different screen sizes.
